headline.kicker: SENATE APPROVES A BUDGET FOR '88 WITH $18 BILLION TAX INCREASE...
headline.main: SENATE APPROVES A BUDGET FOR '88 WITH $18 BILLION TAX INCREASE...; ...AND IT MIGHT COST MORE TO DRINK, SMOKE AND DRIVE

byline.original: By GARY KLOTT, Special to the New York Times

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: Excise taxes have emerged as the only palatable option that Congressional tax writers see to raise $18 billion in new revenue to meet the 1988 budget target. Such a move would confront motorists, smokers, drinkers and telephone users with the steepest rise in Federal excise taxes ever.
